result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Court ordered Defendant to have NO CONTACT with Antonio D., Michael H., Angel J., and Timothy H.
Court ordered Defendant to have NO CONTACT with CO-DEFENDANT, Karvon Matthews (Case 22CF2356).

Court ordered Defendant TURNED OVER TO JUSTICE POINT FOR LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. 
Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Morgan Danielle Jackson in Court, in custody.  Attorney Jason A Findling in Court for Morgan Danielle Jackson.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Court reviewed Defense Motion for Modification of Bail. Discussion placed on the record. Court addressed Defendant's Demand for Speedy Trial. State complied with Victim Notification. Statements by the parties. State did NOT object to Signature Bond. Defense confirmed. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Court set SIGNATURE BOND. 
Court ordered case adjourned for Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46.
Jury Trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
ALL PARTIES MUST APPEAR IN-PERSON IN ROOM 113 OF THE SAFETY BUILDING.

Defendant Morgan Danielle Jackson not in Court, in custody.  Attorney Jason A Findling in Court for Morgan Danielle Jackson.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty and Attorney Owen M Piotrowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Due to Court congestion, Defendant was NOT produced to the Courtroom for first call. Defendant's appearance waived for first call. Court reviewed State's Motion to Adjourn. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. Defense is ready to proceed. Due to COVID-19 protocol, State is NOT ready to procced and requested an adjournment. Court granted State's Motion. Court addressed Defendant's Demand for Speedy Trial. Court ordered case adjourned for Bail/Bond hearing and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46.

Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
Jury Trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

COURT LOWERED CASH BAIL TO $50,000.00.
All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. 
COURT LOWERED CASH BAIL.

Defendant Morgan Danielle Jackson in Court, in custody.  Attorney Jason A Findling in Court for Morgan Danielle Jackson.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Court reviewed Defense Supplemental Motion in Limine and Motion for Modification of Bail. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. Arguments heard regarding Supplemental Motion in Limine. For reasons stated on the record, Court will likely grant Defense Motion; however, Court would like to hear from Detective Savagian. Court will issue a decision on the day of trial. GRANTED. No additional issues need to be addressed at this time. Court ordered case adjourned for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. ALL PARTIES MUST APPEAR IN-PERSON FOR FIRST CALL.
Defense Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bail; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Defendant's Supplemental Motion in Limine; received and filed.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 16 pages) commencing 07-11-2022 by Danielle N. Holcomb.

Defendant Morgan Danielle Jackson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jason A Findling appeared by video for Morgan Danielle Jackson.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.** 
Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. State provided update to Court regarding Crime Lab Results and Nibin testing. Defense provided update regarding witness. For reasons stated on the record State requested adjournment. Defense did not object. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial hearing and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 8:30 am. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.  
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
State's Motion in Limine; received and filed.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions; received and filed.
State's Witness List; received and filed.
Defense Proposed Jury Instructions; received and filed.
Defense Witness List; received and filed.
Defense Motion in Limine; received and filed.

Attorney Jason A Findling in Court, Defendant Morgan Danielle Jackson not in Court, in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.** 
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant's appearance waived for today's hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material from the State. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:15 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant entered a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.
Expires November 7, 2022

Defendant Morgan Danielle Jackson in court with Attorney Jason A Findling; both appear by video.  Defendant Morgan Danielle Jackson in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 21CF5271. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective E. Fitting. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Morgan Danielle Jackson in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Morgan Danielle Jackson in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
